repo.name: tree-sitter-bash
repo.description: Bash grammar for tree-sitter

readme.summary: Clear project description but completely lacks end-user documentation, focusing only on development setup instead of how to actually use the package.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions or usage examples for Python users—only npm development commands are shown, leaving pypi users without guidance on how to install or use the package

common_complaints: Multiple critical parsing bugs in core bash syntax (variable assignments, substring expansion, test commands, variable expansion)
Extglob syntax unsupported despite being a standard bash feature
Broken npm scripts and missing dependencies
No response or engagement from maintainers on recent issues
praise_themes: Recognition of excellent work on bash parsing (mentioned in one issue)
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor with critical unresolved parsing bugs, broken tooling, and no maintainer engagement over recent weeks.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-02)
55 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months indicates unresponsiveness
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows lack of development activity
positive_signals: Recent commit activity exists (though not within 6-month window)
maintenance.summary: Project appears abandoned with significant unresolved issues and zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months.

project_metrics.description: Bash grammar for tree-sitter
